meanings.definition: Able to be forgiven or overlooked
meanings.sent1: The mistake was easily condonable by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her apology was sincere and her actions were condonable.
meanings.sent3: Even though he spilled juice on the carpet, his cute smile made it condonable.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style made his unconventional behavior condonable.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's innocent eyes made his mischief condonable.
